title: Man Utd make decision over re-signing Zlatan Ibrahimovic
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has been linked with a return to Manchester United (SIPA USA/PA Images)

Manchester United will pass up the chance to re-sign Zlatan Ibrahimovic in the January transfer window, according to reports.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer admits he is short of options in attack after allowing both Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez to join Inter in the summer.

Anthony Martial’s hamstring injury has depleted United’s attack even further in recent weeks with the French forward missing eight games.

Solskjaer has made it clear that United will be looking to sign a new striker in the January transfer window and Ibrahimovic, who scored 29 goals in 53 games during his time at Old Trafford, has been linked with a return.

Ibrahimovic has scored 30 goals for LA Galaxy this season (Getty Images)

But according to the Daily Telegraph, United’s hierarchy are against a re-signing Ibrahimovic.

The report claims that United are not looking to sign a ‘short-term fix’ in the January window, which rules out Ibrahimovic, who turned 38 earlier this month.

The Swedish striker has scored 30 goals in 29 appearances for LA Galaxy this season but his future is unclear with his contract expiring in December.

At that point, Ibrahimovic would be free to return to Europe and speaking last week, the forward made it clear that he is still capable of playing at the highest level.

Could Ibrahimovic be a good short-term fix at Manchester United? (Getty Images)

Asked if he could still play in Serie A, Ibrahimovic replied: ‘Oh 100 per cent, I know I could still make the difference, both in Italy and in other countries.

‘I’d do better than the players who are there now.

‘My contract expires in December and I don’t know what will happen after that.’

United, meanwhile, have reportedly reached a verbal agreement to sign Juventus striker Mario Mandzukic in January.

The 33-year-old came close to joining United in the summer but has not played a single minute for Juventus this season.
